recipeTool

Class Book

  • java.lang.Object
    • recipeTool.Book
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    final class Book
extends Object
implements Serializable
    This class contains all the recipes. It stores the following information:
    -recipe name
    -instructions
    -ingredients (name and amount)

    This class will retrieve additional information from Storage:
    -summary of ingredients allergens
    -the soonest expiration date and related ingredient
    -does the Storage has enough ingredients to prepare the recipe at least once?

    The getter methods only return immutable objects and copies of mutable objects, so no changes can be made without proper validation.

    Author:
    Ville Salmela

    • Field Detail

      • map

        private final Map<String,Object[]> map
        This Map holds all the recipes.
        Key: String recipe name
        Value: Object array [instructions, ingredients map]

        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Book

        Book()
        Constructs a new book, with no recipes.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear()
        This method will delete all recipes in the Book.

      • deleteAllIngredients

        void deleteAllIngredients(String iname)
        This method will remove one ingredient from all recipes. If any recipe becomes empty (has no ingredients), the recipe will be removed.
        Parameters:
        iname - The ingredient name, which should be removed.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is empty or null.

      • deleteRecipe

        void deleteRecipe(String name)
        This method will remove one recipe from the book.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the recipe to be removed. Cannot be null or empty.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the recipe with attribute name does not exist in book.
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is null/empty

      • filterRecipes

        String[] filterRecipes(List<String> mustHave,
                       List<String> avoidAllergens,
                       boolean enough,
                       boolean sort)
        This method will filter recipes based on multiple parameters.
        Parameters:
        mustHave - List of those ingredients which must be present in the desired recipe. Cannot be null.
        avoidAllergens - List of those allergens which must NOT be present in the desired recipe. Cannot be null.
        enough - true if there must be enough ingredients in storage, to prepare the recipe at least once, false otherwise.
        sort - true if the recipes should be sorted alphabetically, false if they should be sorted by expiration date.
        Returns:
        A list with desired recipes, or null if there are none.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if mustHave or avoidAllergens is null.

      • getAllergens

        TreeSet<String> getAllergens(String rname)
        This method will list all allergens that the specified recipe contains.
        Parameters:
        rname - The recipe name.
        Returns:
        A list of allergens, or null if there are none.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the recipe named rname does not exist in book.
        IllegalArgumentException - if rname is null/empty

      • getAmount

        double getAmount(String rname,
                 String iname)
        This method will get amount of one ingredient in one recipe.
        Parameters:
        rname - The recipe name.
        iname - The ingredient name.
        Returns:
        The amount of the ingredient in certain recipe, never null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either name is empty or null.
        NoSuchElementException - if the recipe doesn't exist in book, or ingredient doesn't exist in the recipe.

      • getExpiration

        Object[] getExpiration(String rname)
        This method will check which one of the recipe's ingredients has the soonest expiration date.
        Parameters:
        rname - The recipe name.
        Returns:
        An object array, containing the [expiration date, ingredient name].
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the recipe with attribute rname does not exist in book.
        IllegalArgumentException - if rname is null/empty

      • getIngredients

        private LinkedHashMap<String,Double> getIngredients(String key)
        This is a private method, which returns a map containing ingredients and their amounts, for one recipe.
        The method just retrieves the second object from object array, which is mapped to a recipe name in map
        Parameters:
        key - The recipe name.
        Returns:
        A Map which contains the ingredient names and their amounts for one recipe, in the same order they were inputed.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if key is null or empty.
        NoSuchElementException - if there is no such recipe in the book.

      • getInsturction

        String getInsturction(String rname)
        This method will get instructions for one recipe.
        Parameters:
        rname - The recipe name.
        Returns:
        String containing the instructions, or null if there is none.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is empty or null.
        NoSuchElementException - if the recipe named rname does not exist in book.

      • hasIngredient

        boolean hasIngredient(String rname,
                      String iname)
        This method will check, if the specified recipe contains the specified ingredient.
        Parameters:
        rname - The name of the recipe.
        iname - The name of the ingredient.
        Returns:
        true if the recipe contains the ingredient
        false if the recipe does NOT contain the ingredient.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if rname or iname is null/empty.
        NoSuchElementException - if the recipe does not exist in the book.

      • hasRecipe

        boolean hasRecipe(String name)
        This method will check, if the book contains the specified recipe.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the recipe. Cannot be null or empty.
        Returns:
        true if the recipe is in the book.
        false if the recipe is NOT in the book.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is null/empty.

      • isEnough

        boolean isEnough(String rname)
        This method will check, if there is enough ingredients in Storage, to prepare the recipe at least once.
        Parameters:
        rname - Recipe name
        Returns:
        true if there is enough ingredients in Storage,
        false if there is NOT enough ingredients in Storage.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the recipe does not exist in the book.
        IllegalArgumentException - if rname is null/empty.

      • listIngredients

        LinkedHashSet<String> listIngredients(String rname)
        This method will list all ingredient names in specified recipe.
        Parameters:
        rname - The name of the recipe.
        Returns:
        A list of all the ingredient names in one recipe, in the order of input, never null.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the recipe does not exist in the book.
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is null/empty.

      • listRecipes

        TreeSet<String> listRecipes()
        This method will list all recipes in the book.
        Returns:
        A list containing all recipes, sorted alphabetically, never null.

      • renameIngredient

        void renameIngredient(String original,
                      String replacing)
        This method will rename one ingredient in all recipes.
        Parameters:
        original - The old name.
        replacing - The new name.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either name is null or empty.

      • setRecipe

        void setRecipe(String name,
               String instruction,
               LinkedHashMap<String,Double> ingredient)
        throws InvalidDataException
        This method will insert one recipe into the book with the specified attributes. If the recipe already exists, new values will replace existing values.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the recipe. Cannot be null or empty.
        instruction - The instruction for the recipe, or null if there is none.
        ingredient - A map of ingredients, containing ingredient names and amounts.
        Ingredient name cannot be null or empty and amount cannot be null or negative.
        There has to be at least one pair in the map.
        Throws:
        InvalidDataException - if any parameter is not accepted.

      • whoHas

        TreeSet<String> whoHas(String iname)
        This method will check, which recipes contain a specified ingredient.
        Parameters:
        iname - Ingredient name
        Returns:
        A list of all recipes which contain the ingredient, sorted alphabetically, never null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if iname is null/empty.
